meanings.sent1: The gunk on the table was hard to clean.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally stepped in some gunk on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The gunk on my hands made them stick together like glue.
meanings.sent4: The gunk in the drain was like a stubborn enemy, refusing to budge.
meanings.sent5: The gunk in the old pipes was so thick, it felt like trying to walk through mud.

meanings.definition: To become clogged or coated with a sticky substance
meanings.sent1: If you don't clean the blender, it will gunk up.
meanings.sent2: The gears of the machine gunked after being exposed to oil.
meanings.sent3: The syrup started to gunk up the nozzle, making it hard to pour.
meanings.sent4: The old engine gunked up with rust, refusing to start.
meanings.sent5: Leaving the paintbrush in water caused it to gunk up with dried paint.

meanings.sent1: The garage was a gunk of tools and old boxes.
meanings.sent2: After the party, the living room was a gunk of spilled drinks and snacks.
meanings.sent3: The kids turned the backyard into a gunk of toys and mud.
meanings.sent4: The attic was a gunk of forgotten treasures and dust.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house was a gunk of cobwebs and debris.
